translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  āsavaduka

original: Noāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Noāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽nanoāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Noāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noāsavo ca nanoāsavo
analyzed: noāsavam dhammam paṭicca no āsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā noāsavam dhammam paṭicca  na no āsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā no āsavam dhammam paṭicca no āsavaḥ ca na no āsavaḥ
translated: With a non-corrupted idea as condition, a non-corrupted idea arises, by way of root-cause condition. With a non-corrupted idea as condition,
a corrupted idea arises, by way of root-cause condition. With a non-corrupted idea as condition, a non-corrupted idea and a corrupted idea arise, by way of root-cause condition.

original: Nanoāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanoāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Noāsavañca nanoāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca noāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Noāsavañca🔽nanoāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nanoāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Noāsavañca nanoāsavañca
analyzed: na noāsavam dhammam paṭicca na noāsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  noāsavañca na noāsavañca dhammam paṭicca noāsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā noāsavañca  na no āsavañca dhammam paṭicca na no āsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā no āsavañca na no āsavañca
translated: With a corrupted idea as condition, a corrupted idea arises, by way of root-cause condition. … three.🔽With a non-corrupted and a corrupted idea as condition, a non-corrupted idea arises, by way of root-cause condition. With a non-corrupted and a corrupted idea as condition,

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca noāsavo ca nanoāsavo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca noāsavaḥ ca na noāsavaḥ ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: a corrupted idea arises, by way of root-cause condition. With a non-corrupted and a corrupted idea as condition, a non-corrupted idea and a corrupted idea arise, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava sabbattha vitthāro
